# Vue.js Skill

> Progressive JavaScript framework for building user interfaces

## When to Use

Use this skill when building Vue.js applications with Composition API or Options API.

## Key Concepts

| Concept | Description | Use Case |
|---------|-------------|----------|
| Composition API | Function-based component logic | Reusable logic, TypeScript |
| Reactivity | ref, reactive, computed | State management |
| Components | Single File Components (.vue) | UI building blocks |
| Directives | v-if, v-for, v-model | Template logic |

## Composition API Basics

```vue
<script setup>
import { ref, computed, watch, onMounted } from 'vue'

// Reactive state
const count = ref(0)
const user = ref({ name: 'John' })

// Computed
const doubleCount = computed(() => count.value * 2)

// Watch
watch(count, (newVal, oldVal) => {
  console.log(`Count changed from ${oldVal} to ${newVal}`)
})

// Lifecycle
onMounted(() => {
  console.log('Component mounted')
})

// Methods
function increment() {
  count.value++
}
</script>

<template>
  <div>
    <p>Count: {{ count }}</p>
    <p>Double: {{ doubleCount }}</p>
    <button @click="increment">Increment</button>
  </div>
</template>
```

## Reactivity

```typescript
import { ref, reactive, computed, watchEffect } from 'vue'

// ref for primitives
const count = ref(0)
count.value++ // Access via .value

// reactive for objects
const state = reactive({
  items: [],
  loading: false
})
state.loading = true // Direct access

// computed
const total = computed(() => state.items.length)

// watchEffect (auto-tracks dependencies)
watchEffect(() => {
  console.log(`Items: ${state.items.length}`)
})
```

## Component Props & Events

```vue
<script setup>
// Props with defaults
const props = defineProps({
  title: String,
  count: { type: Number, default: 0 }
})

// Emits
const emit = defineEmits(['update', 'delete'])

function handleUpdate() {
  emit('update', { id: 1, data: '...' })
}
</script>
```

## Template Directives

```vue
<template>
  <!-- Conditionals -->
  <div v-if="loading">Loading...</div>
  <div v-else-if="error">Error: {{ error }}</div>
  <div v-else>Content</div>

  <!-- Lists -->
  <ul>
    <li v-for="item in items" :key="item.id">
      {{ item.name }}
    </li>
  </ul>

  <!-- Two-way binding -->
  <input v-model="searchQuery" />

  <!-- Event handling -->
  <button @click="handleClick">Click</button>
  <form @submit.prevent="handleSubmit">...</form>
</template>
```

## Pitfalls

- Use `ref` for primitives, `reactive` for objects
- Don't destructure reactive objects (loses reactivity)
- Use `shallowRef` for large objects that don't need deep reactivity
- Remember `.value` when accessing refs in script
